image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house

image.altText: A man stands between two ceremonial poles

props.synopsis: The family of vanished Yol≈ãu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.

title.children: Investigation unearths name of alleged confessed killer police officer

image.altText: A close-up side profile of a man with thick brown hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's lawyers have revealed the five grounds they are seeking to appeal their client's guilty verdict on, including an allegation that the judge made an "impermissible comment to the jury".

title.children: Matt Wright's five grounds of appeal include allegation against judge

image.altText: a black and white dog at a vet receiving intravenous care

props.synopsis: Canine ehrlichiosis was first detected in Australia in 2020 but is now endemic and spreading across the country's north. One veterinarian says the illness "has left a lot of destruction in its wake".

title.children: Deadly tick-borne dog disease here to stay, warns vet

image.altText: An ultra close-up shot of a baby crocodile with its jaws open.

props.synopsis: Thrust back into the international spotlight by the recent trial of Outback Wrangler star Matt Wright, questions are being raised about the Top End's lucrative crocodile industry and its outdated code of practice.

title.children: The $151 million luxury industry working on outdated regulations

image.altText: An artist's impression of a large hotel next to a body of water.

props.synopsis: A new law has forced the NT's sacred sites watchdog to clear the way for the NT government and a Singapore-backed developer to move forward with plans for a new Darwin Waterfront hotel, in a move one critic has labelled "legislative vandalism".

title.children: 'You lose out': Hotel plan passes sacred sites obstacle despite concerns

image.altText: A girl with dark hair using her hands to sign Auslan.

props.synopsis: Access to language is essential for the Deaf community, but it isn't always guaranteed ‚Äî especially in isolated parts of Australia. Locals are advocating for more awareness and support this International Week of Deaf People.

title.children: Sofie is teaching her baby sister sign and wants other Australians to learn too

image.altText: A view of an Antarctic ice sheet.

props.synopsis: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

title.children: Antarctic and Southern Ocean security in spotlight after failed funding bid

image.altText: A close up of the word 'POLICE' on a white car

props.synopsis: SA Police say "time is of the essence" in their search for a four-year-old boy who has been missing from his family's homestead in South Australia's mid-north since Saturday evening.

title.children: Police still 'hopeful' in search for missing four-year-old boy in remote SA

image.altText: Chalmers gestures while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's budget bottom line has come in better than expected but we are still about $10 billion in the red, new figures released today confirm. Follow live.

title.children: Budget deficit about $18b lower than forecast

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese appearance at UK Labour conference an 'exercise in vanity'
Budget deficit about $18b lower than forecast last year

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a church fully engulfed in flame.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a 40-year-old man rammed his pick-up truck through the front door, then got out of the vehicle and started shooting.

title.children: Four dead after gunman opens fire in US church before setting it on fire

image.altText: Kwar Ater, wearing a white shirt and smiling hugely.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old was shot dead in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month, leaving his shocked family in search of answers.

title.children: 'Wanted to be part of something': 26yo killed as life was turning a corner

image.altText: Dawn light boat being towed behind another.

props.synopsis: Two men have been rescued with their catamaran after being adrift for two days following an engine failure off the northern NSW coast.

title.children: Missing sailors towed to shore after two days adrift off northern NSW coast

image.altText: Illustration of woman wearing Star of David necklace, wearing a green top and hand on chest

props.synopsis: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: 'High level of distrust of medical staff': Trauma remains after nurses' video

image.altText: A man cheers during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Neither Melbourne nor Brisbane is approaching perfection ahead of their grand final showdown, but with what they've been through, neither team would want to.

title.children: The clash of furious styles that will define the 2025 NRL grand final

image.altText: A tank sitting in a field, firing an artillery round out of its front gun.

props.synopsis: The military wing of Hamas is calling for Israel to pull troops back and suspend air strikes for 24 hours so fighters can retrieve the captives.

title.children: Hamas loses contact with two hostages as Gaza offensive deepens

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

title.children: Fusion-power deal heralds beginning of next great energy transition

image.altText: Back of woman in black top and jeans with long dark hair arms outstretched on stage in front of packed room hands in the air

props.synopsis: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition ‚Äî she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

title.children: How an email from reclusive star Kate Bush catapulted Astrid to world fame

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Wall Street snapped a 3-day losing streak with solid gains on Friday. Follow today's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street gains on positive inflation data, ASX poised to lift

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A bitter pill or flooding the zone? What to make of the latest Trump tariff deluge
Chances of a rate cut on Tuesday slipping away

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt sits on a staircase next to a photo of a woman

props.synopsis: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid, but says he will "continue to fight for this city" until his term ends on January 1 2026.

title.children: New York City Mayor Eric Adams drops re-election bid after unpopular tenure

image.altText: Woman in orange jumper looking sad at camera.

props.synopsis: The Victorian relief service that's fed those in need in the Wimmera for almost 30 years has had its funding slashed.

title.children: Blow for struggling families as food relief centres lose funding

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

title.children: Grieving family's anger at lack of licence reform amidst government 'buck-passing'

image.altText: Three young boys sit behind a train set. The boy in the centre is looking at the camera while the others look at the train.

props.synopsis: It's been dubbed "the forgotten pandemic" ‚Äî possibly because it coincided with some of the most momentous events in world history. But Dr John Gerrard argues variants of the H3N2 flu, which led to the Hong Kong flu pandemic, continue to cost lives.

title.children: The deadly legacy of the Hong Kong flu and its parallels to COVID-19

image.altText: Man looking at a picture of woman on mobile phone

props.synopsis: NSW courts can now allow police to monitor domestic violence offenders' phones and make them self-report if they open dating profiles.

title.children: DV offenders to self-report new dating profiles to police under new orders

image.altText: A large truck signed ROAD TRAIN on a bitumen road with green vegetation either side.

props.synopsis:
Road haulage industry leaders are planning a national campaign against using indicators as a signal it is safe to overtake.

¬†

title.children: National campaign against indicator flash as unofficial overtaking signal

image.altText: Mal sits and smiles in the stands with other starts, wearing a red t-shirt.

props.synopsis: It was 25 years ago when Cathy Freeman crossed the line into history, winning gold in the 400m at the 2000 Olympics, a moment that's vivid in the memory of gun starter Mal Davies.

title.children: How starter Mal stayed calm before Cathy Freeman's winning race

image.altText: GettyImages-2237653296

props.synopsis: India defeats Pakistan with just two balls remaining in the Asia Cup final, then refuses to claim the trophy.

title.children: Farcical scenes as India lifts 'invisible trophy' after Asia Cup victory

image.altText: A fishing boat lilts in dirty, rough water as rescuers hold ropes.

props.synopsis: As Typhoon Bualoi approaches Vietnam, thousands of people are seeking safer ground.

title.children: Typhoon Bualoi forces thousands to evacuate in Vietnam

image.altText: image of tiny home on wheels.

props.synopsis: Shellharbour Council approves a plan for a tiny homes planning pathway which it says could be adopted statewide, as owners face uncertainty around legal installation.

title.children: 'Easy way forward' for tiny homes as NSW-first pilot gets greenlight

image.altText: A windmill and streetscape in Cloncurry

props.synopsis: Clear, bright and sunny skies are expected as the Sunshine State's school holidays continue this week.¬†

title.children: Outback temperatures to push 40C during Queensland school holidays

image.altText: Close up photo of a southern pygmy perch in a human hand.

props.synopsis: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.¬†

title.children: Rings on 'ear stones' helping re-establish native pygmy fish

image.altText: A woman and a child sit on a toy bed reading a book with cutout characters of a boy and a cat on the wall behind them.

props.synopsis: At 91, Pamela Allen has published more than 60 books. This exhibition brings her work off the page and invites children and adults to play as they read.

title.children: Who Sank the Boat? Pamela Allen's stories come to life in this exhibit
